Cookie Usage

-

What are Cookies?

-

Like most websites, SearchYourTour utilizes cookies to improve your browsing experience and gain insights into how visitors interact with our site.

-

Cookies are small text files stored on your computer or device's browser. These files are placed by our website's server and can only be accessed by that server. Each cookie is unique to your web browser, allowing our site to remember your preferences and actions, such as language settings, visited pages, and potential selections during your pass purchase process.

What Cookies Does SearchYourTour Use?

-

We prioritize your security and only use safe cookies that do not store sensitive personal information. The cookies we employ help us:

+

Types of Cookies We Use

    -
  • Improve the functionality and performance of our website.
    • -
  • Analyze user behavior to enhance our online marketing and promotional activities.
    • -
  • Deliver relevant advertisements based on your browsing patterns.
    • +
  • + Strictly Necessary Cookies: These cookies are essential for the website to function properly and cannot be switched off in our systems. +
    • +
  • + Analytical/Performance Cookies: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously. +
    • +
  • + Advertising/Third-Party Cookies: These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant ads on other sites. +
-

Can I Remove Cookies from My Computer/Device?

-

Yes, you have the option to clear cookies by deleting your browser history. Detailed instructions on how to do this can be found through the resource mentioned above.

-

For more information, please visit Terms & Conditions.

+

How Long Are Cookies Stored?

+

+ Some cookies are session cookies, which are deleted when you close your browser. Others are persistent cookies, which remain on your device for a set period or until you delete them. +

+
+

Third-Party Cookies

+

+ We may use third-party services such as Google Analytics to help us analyze website traffic and usage. These third parties may set their own cookies, which are subject to their privacy policies. +

+
+
+

Managing Your Cookie Preferences

+

+ You can manage or delete cookies at any time through your browser settings. Please note that disabling certain cookies may affect the functionality of our website. +

+

+ For more information, please visit Terms & Conditions. +
